0033829349643e2964a8c3ce5fd997116ce43f7c:
Zimbabwean lawmakers elect Lovemore Moyo as speaker, first opposition member to hold the position.
Moyo's MDC faction has a slim majority in parliament, following parliamentary elections.
Moyo promises to be professional and ensure progressive laws are passed.

Soyuz space ship lands in Kazakhstan with rough ride, 260 miles off target.

00be40289d0aea65afd2da6431db8a9fc8efc9c0:
Atlanta tops Los Angeles in bank robberies, with 350 reported in 12 months.

Atlanta's rapid growth and banking industry expansion contribute to the increase.
0130f10c1d700cf42cad5fd24b242667342c86be:
US Army's official history of Iraq War reveals military chiefs made mistake after mistake in early months.
Insufficient troops and wrong assumptions led to chaos and insurgency in Iraq.

Report details effects of too few coalition troops on ground, including looting and border insecurity.
017d27d00eb43678c15cb4a8dd4723a035323219:
President Bush will compare Iraq war to Vietnam, arguing against US withdrawal.

Bush will argue that US credibility was compromised by withdrawing from Vietnam.
022c18def42072e28a37979c622c6ab7e31371de:
Three French journalists charged in alleged adoption plot arrive in Paris.

02311be4aab97a81d2262963896b975c27f6503d:

0239342f05436085947bd0c5173a4636ee772b51:

Thousands protest in San Francisco against China's human rights record and Tibet crackdown.

027a99a889b38fdb935cd14c204a5fca8a329bc1:
Up to 1,000 human rights campaigners protested outside No. 10 Downing Street in London.

Protesters waved Pakistani flags and carried placards reading "Free the innocent" and "End Musharraf's Regime".
02927c88776bcc84fc883435a5037b4c8ca70e83:
Sixty-four measles cases reported in the US this year, the most in seven years.

Fourteen patients were hospitalized, but no deaths were reported.
03392835ea832d7940082c421a21778c70701ff0:
Wayne Rooney and Coleen McLoughlin to marry in $10 million Italian ceremony.

Wedding to feature private yacht, luxury jet, and $200,000 wedding dress.
03a0cef9c902928979ef731616fb96bd1fb10f9f:
Sen. Hillary Clinton to suspend presidential campaign and support Sen. Barack Obama.

Clinton praises Obama, saying he ran an "extraordinary race."
04327bc3e426eee01ed61d369fd52415aa300ddc:
Honduran President Manuel Zelaya demonstrates safety of cantaloupes by eating one on TV.

047e7bc4c7ea5f7df08d4efc443ac8a3479649f1:
Captain Javier Zanetti scores late equalizer to preserve Inter Milan's unbeaten Serie A record.
Roma's Francesco Totti gives visitors a deserved first-half lead with a well-taken goal.

Zanetti's stunning volley earns Inter a 1-1 draw and maintains their nine-point lead.
04882672036936ca86bdebed819a133539cbd296:
North Korean freighter crew regains control from pirates off Somalia after deadly fight.

04b39ee42fdc4284e402fbf7cdc7b825748f38b5:
Argentina beats Bolivia 3-0 in World Cup qualifiers, with Juan Roman Riquelme scoring twice.
Riquelme's goals come from spectacular free-kicks and a cool sidefoot finish.
Argentina's win puts them five points clear of second-placed Brazil.

04fbd3088e8610dd4d5bea709e7cc5ee3e53710d:
Pope Benedict XVI's US trip has an unofficial motto: "This is not a political event."
The Catholic vote matters in US elections, with 70 million Catholics representing a quarter of the population.
Catholics are diverse and divided, with no clear alignment with either party.
The pope's message may be exploited by both Republicans and Democrats in the 2008 election.
05216d3837745866d393f0e07be7ba801dc330f6:
Adam Gilchrist announces retirement from cricket at end of Australian summer.
Gilchrist to retire from Tests and one-day internationals after current match.

054891b9199a73152564cc5be925250ea282bb00:
A Colorado woman, Rozita Swinton, is a "person of interest" in a polygamist sect's Texas ranch raid.

05688bac0e46542be65a6df240428a6f26c86fd0:
Dale Steyn takes 5-34 as South Africa dominates first test against New Zealand.

South Africa stretches lead to 287, putting pressure on New Zealand.
05850904cabf491c9ab7c0e0d85fd932eb8c0bb0:
Three Americans rescued after five years in captivity in Colombia's jungles appear in good health.

0590a8c653b7d332d9df195dcf3ce014abb4eff7:
Morgan Tsvangirai's supporters, including alleged torture victims, back his decision to pull out of the Zimbabwe runoff.

05c6b2a21f9c0ffd5f0c76c9ce4c6d3d875fcf39:
Barbara Hillary, 75, becomes first African American woman to reach the North Pole.

05fa6152f08a3d64745030124428775768ee3afd:

0612042c0c7d5cf6459f5435402919673c8c552f:
Mychal Bell, a black teenager, was released from custody after a juvenile court judge set his bail at $45,000.

0620ff5fa324a35b4be54bbd2de49b42bdd0d7c0:
Australian Prime Minister Kevin Rudd assured Afghan President Hamid Karzai of a long-term commitment to Afghanistan.

06254d21e94c9c0b027629a1df90298887c31f14:
Angelina Jolie visits Iraq to focus attention on internally displaced people.

06352019a19ae31e527f37f7571c6dd7f0c5da37:
Drivers described harrowing tales of survival after the Minneapolis bridge collapsed.

0644f27692b67af8f52f9518e29981de11684cd7:
Mira Nair's films, from "Mississippi Masala" to "Monsoon Wedding", have entranced audiences worldwide.

065378e265a6d5ff38b2e6748ba66490cf8670a9:
Roman Emperor Hadrian inherited an overstretched empire in 117AD and pulled troops out of Mesopotamia.

066f8568d9c1c23ca3aeb23330123e7dd8967208:
Chinese couples rush to marry on August 8 due to auspicious number significance.

068d37f7a1ee822245dbf9d0d8ddfc281919d7ee:
Tetsuya Kumakawa is considered one of the greatest Japanese ballet dancers of all time.

06bc2f0272d033b123e9eebbb221c62d7d51c283:

06f290a163e81c46437ca61b5fd13741d7db11f2:

0753a471e6908c35bcbc2daa37e21f3a8443b590:

083bc4309f2ea52be2a378e78566d7dcc9f4dd73:

090d322e93af624203dbd5dc83403170071c9e6a:

0914e3c80a676e14e225504cb759103503f3f1e0:
Ronaldinho recalled to Barcelona squad for Champions League match against Rangers.

0961a6a9fef7ad978ab866a57415578a49ba187f:

09b582acc63514f671628e1766ff7e99b258fe9a:

0a71f063b78184b4ca2ffee3c642d48dc27ef91b:

0aa0562353120d93357dc00a05ff4d2bc0312715:

0add6b43e18072837f0bef41031d6f92f740d625:

0b40c6061cfd6a745886150c46eb75a7f43b4efa:
No charges filed against 10-year-old boy accused of starting 38,000-acre wildfire in California.

0e3f2fa30b711144fd8e49dedd6c248542a9083c:

0e649ccabaf0e650e9757ee256c2749d37486ba6:

0e7a92a6f06e94cdd613860d4a3f4b92a06a2b43:

0f4fcaf8fd58c40bc31c4715cd230bb0f80f2d98:

0f60442453e038c6bbe3aa525bedf2a97f459e04:
Texas has the highest speed limit in the country, at 80 mph on rural interstates.

0f937bcc8cd07bab2d5aa9a4492d3c2430063b67:
Zimbabwe President Robert Mugabe warns against outside influences in upcoming election.

1064c47f3d7f0efa03368fe7eb01dd0836017339:
Courtney Larrell Lockhart's mother apologizes for the suffering of Lauren Burk's family, saying "I'm just sorry for the loss of that family."

Powerful storms killed 22 people in three states over the weekend.

Federal support pledged by President Bush to aid in disaster relief efforts.

President Bush defends decision to attend Beijing Olympics, saying boycott would be an affront to Chinese people.

1146cfc5981ce23511ac1bac5f3957c30bebc7b8:

Connie Nielsen, a Danish actress, rejects Hollywood's fame and money-driven culture.

3cae0d9bcf97b5d182b20a31aaea3f41cd7bf599:
Rev. Jeremiah Wright defends black church, saying it's been unfairly attacked in 2008 presidential campaign.
Wright explains his 9/11 comments, saying they were taken out of context and quote biblical principles.
Wright criticizes media for portraying him as divisive and says black church is a "theology of liberation".
Wright emphasizes reconciliation, saying "we embrace our individual rich histories" and recognize God's children are equal.
3cc0409612242093f34ea1d8ca1679f434955cff:
An 18-year-old mother offered herself for sex to get treatment for her baby with leukemia in Iraq.
The baby died two months later, and the mother's desperation is a common story in Iraq.
The Iraqi Red Crescent is struggling to treat and feed over 1.6 million homeless children under 12.
Children are becoming a liability for their parents, who are abandoning them due to desperation.
3cc7c9639fb87922cfac315fbb55641e671a3d99:
Sen. Barack Obama mocked Sen. Hillary Clinton for drinking whiskey in front of TV crews.
Obama said Clinton is "toughening him up" for a fall race against Republican Sen. John McCain.
Clinton called Obama's "bitter" comments "elitist, out of touch and frankly, patronizing."
Obama blasted Clinton for acting like "Annie Oakley" while trying to connect with gun owners.
3de916a84cae6c1dee0076f4e5d6e26fc95c3242:
Flash floods and landslides triggered by Tropical Storm Kammuri kill at least 100 people in Vietnam.
Flooding damages tens of thousands of homes, sweeps away thousands of cattle, and submerges crops.
More than two dozen people remain missing, with thousands of rescue workers deployed to affected areas.
Heavy rainfall during the May-September monsoon season makes Vietnam prone to deadly landslides and floods.
3e5a3a2dddee7ebebe57c12d0ace97a24cbabd72:
Three US soldiers killed and 31 wounded in rocket attacks in Baghdad.
Fighting between US troops and Mehdi Army militia leaves 20 dead and 52 wounded.
Iraqi Prime Minister Nuri al-Maliki demands Muqtada al-Sadr disband his militia.
US death toll in Iraq war reaches 4,022, with nearly 30,000 wounded.
3e868fbad714ceab14a41fa9dd5d8a40204f2199:
Gary Vaynerchuk, 31, hosts "Wine Library TV" and tastes unusual wines on camera.
He appeals to young wine enthusiasts with his casual, humorous approach.
The show has 40,000 daily viewers, many of whom are 20-somethings.
Wine sites like "Wine Library TV" aim to demystify wine and make it more accessible.
3e910c5b8425cd7c871a402a32ca44680b53ce5e:
Mary Winkler, convicted of killing her minister husband, wins visitation rights with her three daughters.
The Tennessee Supreme Court refused to modify or overturn a lower court's ruling.
Winkler has not seen her children in 15 months and may see them before Christmas.
She was convicted of voluntary manslaughter and received a three-year sentence.
3ee31d8987c07ba4ea9423d39c5e333525316958:
Amnesty International's annual report focuses on human rights, freedom of press, and political dissent in China, US, and Russia.
China's human rights record criticized for detaining activists, restricting free speech, and executing prisoners.
US criticized for detaining Guantanamo Bay detainees without charge, using torture, and executing 42 people in 2007.
Amnesty calls for global leadership to address human rights issues, citing Darfur, Zimbabwe, Gaza, Iraq, and Myanmar as flashpoints.
3f33d4cb25cd121619ba99eeb02709b72716d622:
A cheaper car's sticker price can often cost more in the long run due to higher maintenance and repair costs.
Depreciation accounts for 48% of the cost of ownership over five years, followed by fuel costs at 21%.
Auto insurance costs can significantly impact ownership costs, with some models costing $2,500 or more per year.
Maintenance and repairs account for only 4% of the cost of ownership, with some models having higher costs due to maintenance alone.
3f6308f2f5b6ccdb89d7b6abe1b9490cc30b8e5f:
11 police recruits and 6 civilians, including a 7-year-old, killed in attacks across Iraq.
US military killed an al Qaeda in Iraq leader in northern Iraq.
Violence erupted as a peace agreement took hold in Baghdad's Sadr City.
Thousands of soldiers and police moved into Sadr City without resistance.
3f7e19cffef13f356e2298c5a63e6c8db20f3d91:
Air Force returns F-15E Strike Eagle jets to service in Iraq and Afghanistan.
Grounding of other F-15s due to crash of older model F-15C in Missouri.
F-15Es must pass inspection of critical parts before returning to flying missions.
Older F-15s remain grounded pending investigation into crash.
3ffb4210cf832dc039ffe7522c47c6eb7a5e5ab5:
Twenty-nine people convicted of various crimes were hanged in Iran, state TV said.
Convicts were found guilty of murder, drug dealing, armed robbery, and other crimes.
The hangings were intended to serve as a warning to those who contemplate similar crimes.
Iran executed 317 people last year, second only to China.
40e79de5b7a27d7161b147725936d1d47e45c8f9:
Manchester City sent representatives to Brazil to persuade Ronaldinho to join the team.
City chairman Garry Cook confirmed Barcelona gave permission to speak with Ronaldinho.
Ronaldinho could become the Premier League's highest-paid player with a £29.5 million deal.
City owner Shinawatra Thaksin is willing to pay £50 million for new players.
412630c97420afb50e5278d3406e0cf4b08d0b77:
Warren Jeffs, polygamist sect leader, tried to hang himself in jail in January.
He was convicted of being an accomplice to rape and awaits sentencing.
Jeffs confessed to "immorality" with a "sister" and a daughter over 30 years ago.
He recanted the confessions, citing a medical condition and influence from his brother.
4141e012912dbf29c5e792b8654a9a36094b468c:
I-Report launched on August 2, 2006, to involve citizens in newsgathering.
Mark Lacroix sent photos of the Minneapolis bridge collapse immediately after.
I-Report received over 450 submissions in 24 hours, a single-day record.
Citizens have submitted photos, video, and spoken with reporters during major events.
41431356e1e7c6f94057b262cd284987f9edb184:
Two anti-whaling activists seized by Japanese whaling vessel, handed over to Australian officials in Antarctic.
Benjamin Potts and Giles Lane jumped on board to deliver letter protesting whaling, accused of violating international law.
Japanese government did not lay out conditions for transfer, Australian Foreign Minister says.
Sea Shepherd claims activists were assaulted and kidnapped, Japan calls them "terrorists".
414a5b8ecbe189d2767c75b839775a1dcafaf4d3:
Blackwater USA denies allegations of unlawful arms activities in Iraq.
Federal prosecutors investigate claims of illegal weapons purchases and sales.
Blackwater fired two employees caught stealing, inviting ATF investigation.
State Department cooperating with probe, resumes normal security operations.
4160464d3fcba547cb1664e54ce51ad06f78b773:
Sen. Barack Obama raised $40 million in March from over 442,000 donors.
More than 218,000 were first-time donors, the campaign said.
Obama's total surpasses the Democratic record of $215 million.
He is $25 million shy of President Bush's fundraising record.
41698f361bcf6415f711719ed0c2f6817205c091:
Danish authorities arrested three people plotting to assassinate a cartoonist who drew the Prophet Mohammed.
The cartoonist, Kurt Westergaard, was the target of the plot, which was foiled by the authorities.
The arrests were made in the Aarhus area of western Denmark, following lengthy surveillance.
The plot was allegedly a "terror-related assassination" aimed at Westergaard, who remains under police protection.
41b5dd6064864c16fbde9b46d37c9f7d9a56e705:
Brooke Burns, 29, shares makeup tips with her 7-year-old daughter, including "a dab'll do ya".
She uses Revlon Color Stay foundation, which stays all day and has sunscreen.
Burns prefers being a brunette, saying it makes people focus on her face.
She credits her healthy hair to Nature's Therapy shampoo and Paul Mitchell Fudge Brownie color.
42176b852f897ae19ef0cf39d598878c8ff0bced:
Christina Laurean says she was at a Christmas party on the night her husband allegedly killed pregnant Marine Maria Lauterbach.
Cesar Laurean, a Marine, is charged with first-degree murder and remains at large, possibly in Mexico.
Laurean's wife reported the death a day after learning about it, according to an affidavit.
Lauterbach's charred remains and those of her unborn child were found in the Laureans' backyard.
42474528588bac3a27842671a3fa940fed450552:
Betty Neumar, 76, charged with soliciting murder of her husband Harold Gentry in 1986.
Her son wonders if she poisoned his father, who died from intestinal problems.
She has been married five times, with four previous husbands also dying under unclear circumstances.
Authorities investigating deaths of her previous husbands, including John Neumar Sr.
42483672c204aebcf7ba6e7d6ca4c628fe9a69e7:
Top three Democratic presidential candidates debate in Myrtle Beach, South Carolina.
Debate focuses on African-American voters, with Obama leading among this demographic.
Obama addresses Ebenezer Baptist Church, where Martin Luther King Jr. once preached.
Obama leads Clinton among African-Americans, with 60% backing him in a recent poll.
42ab0385b3bb93236804c2abc9ff261b6ec79872:
Heavy rains and flooding in southern Mexico's Tabasco state force hundreds of thousands to flee their homes.

About 300,000 people remain trapped by the worst flooding in 50 years, with 700,000 homes affected.

The Grijalva River has risen 6.5 feet above its critical level, flooding up to 80% of Villahermosa city.

President Felipe Calderon visits the area, promising full federal support, as more rain is predicted.
42be47d5986a9a55b413eb57359d2d8c51b59024:
High school valedictorian Arthur Mkoyan faces deportation to Armenia despite plans to study medicine at a California state university.
He was 2 when his family fled Armenia due to his father's refusal to take a bribe.
Immigration officers took his father away, and 10 days later, plan to deport the family to Yerevan.
Arthur's academic achievements have not helped his case, and a private bill to stay in the US is unlikely.
42c027e4ff9730fbb3de84c1af0d2c506e41c3e4:
Daniel Radcliffe turns 18, gaining access to £20 million fortune.
He plans to spend his money wisely, not on luxury items.
Radcliffe will celebrate his birthday with a party, details unknown.
He aims to keep his feet on the ground, avoiding celebrity excess.
42e93d5aef7547b8169f1f6c7735d0265a030580:
Mexico deploys 2,000 troops to US-Mexico border to combat drug-related violence.
Troops will be stationed near Juarez, across from El Paso, Texas.
Violence is blamed on competing drug cartels and has resulted in 200 deaths since January.
Military operation aims to show government strength and combat organized crime.
43144b95b0f947f2c6d40122fecd69ced8a4af92:
German zookeepers are bottle-feeding a 4-week-old polar bear cub due to concerns its mother might eat it.
The cub is thriving in human care, but its mother, Vera, is showing signs of distress.
Vera's previous cubs were eaten by her, leading zookeepers to take precautions with the new cub.
The zoo is considering introducing another adult bear to help Vera overcome her loss.
438a2046f4465fb1f6dab1cb327ef9ca86a4cc0d:
Kenya's reputation as a stable nation hides widespread poverty, violent crime, and corruption.
Tribal bonds remain strong, with 40 tribes claiming allegiance, and ethnic tensions simmering.
Incumbent President Mwai Kibaki won the election, but the result is questioned by international observers.
Violence erupted in slums, particularly in Kibera, where opposition leader Raila Odinga enjoys strong support.
438e8eaa1c64cb59288f9954355d0100181d19a2:
Indonesian businessman Tung Desem Waringin dropped $10,700 from an airplane to promote his new book.
Cash was scattered over a soccer field, with people scrambling to pick up the bills.
The stunt was to promote Tung's book "Marketing Revolution" and generate buzz.
The publicity stunt was expected to generate a tremendous response amidst rising food and fuel prices.
43d42fe40ada4406377bc3b45c123a75552c21a0:
The US government paid over $1.7 million to companies owned by leaders of Warren Jeffs' polygamous sect.
Tens of thousands of dollars allegedly went back to Jeffs and his church.
The Pentagon had contracts with three companies tied to the sect, despite Jeffs being on the FBI's "Most-Wanted List".
Jeffs' church, FLDS, practices polygamy and has been linked to child abuse and forced marriage.
44815c184e3013f07781311b30ec5ff009174738:
Riots erupt in Paris suburbs after two teens killed in motorcycle crash with police car.
Violence spreads to nearby towns, with police injured and cars, buildings set on fire.
Eyewitnesses say police stayed at the scene, trying to revive the teens.
Over 60 police officers injured, with five in serious condition.
449c536051eba7070b18a7b33ebcf024891cb913:
Lebanon's civil war resumed, with bombings and assassinations returning to Beirut.
The author, a Lebanese woman, reflects on her childhood experience of the war.
A presidential election is underway, with sectarian rivalries threatening to derail progress.
The country's brief renaissance in the 1990s may be snuffed out by old rivalries.
44bdf9aa9712197110017fca533785653210f1ea:
Pete Sampras upset Roger Federer 7-6 6-4 in an exhibition match in Macau.
Sampras won despite Federer's strong season, citing his big serve and fast surface.
Federer was gracious in defeat, saying he wasn't embarrassed to lose to his idol.
Sampras ruled out a comeback, saying he had his time in the 90s.
44fc3a2bc441a674f1ebdeabae73278977909db4:
A car bomb attack in Algeria killed three and wounded 23 near an office housing judicial police.
The blast destroyed about 20 houses in the city of Thenia, 50 km east of Algiers.
Islamic extremists have struck several times in recent years in Algeria and North Africa.
An al Qaeda affiliate claimed responsibility for the attack.
45027afbe54056c567ca8a48906dd06200f6d8c1:
Yuvraj Singh smashes six sixes in one over, leading India to victory over England.
England crashes out of World Twenty20, eliminated at Super Eights stage.
India's Yuvraj Singh reaches fastest 50 in Twenty20 history, needing just 12 deliveries.
South Africa beats New Zealand by six wickets, keeping semifinal hopes alive.
4567b2098569ee4346cfdede5819257af4ee9c0f:
Capital punishment dropped to a 13-year low this year, with 42 executions.
The Supreme Court will hold oral arguments on January 7 about lethal injection protocols.
New Jersey banned executions, the first state to do so in 42 years.
Texas led the nation in executions, with 62% of the total.
45884af9aff9abf54fec27f510c3f9ed000fc6e1:
Actor Joe Pantoliano attends Democratic National Convention to raise awareness about mental illness.
He's founder and president of No Kidding, Me Too, an advocacy organization for mental health.
Pantoliano has met with Obama and McCain camps to promote mental health and recovery.
He's undecided on who to vote for, but praises Obama's representation of America's melting pot.
45986f43dd61461844801c08c8753a71ccbf9083:
Three aid workers shot in Somalia, two fatally, in targeted attacks in Mogadishu and elsewhere.
Deputy director of Daryeel Bulasho Guud, Mohamed Mohamud Qeyre, killed in Mogadishu.
Head of aid group suspends operations in Somalia due to security concerns.
Fourth WFP driver killed in Somalia this year, amid ongoing humanitarian crisis.
45b9fb89ac2724f2d7de56b2f8c9397bca03326e:
Hundreds of protesters gathered outside the presidential palace to denounce a teacher who named a teddy bear "Mohammed".
Gillian Gibbons was convicted of insulting religion and sentenced to 15 days in jail.
Protesters, some waving swords, shouted "By soul, by blood, I will fight for the Prophet Mohammad".
British lawmakers are en route to Khartoum to secure Gibbons' early release.
46102a68e2927f930c1c2bd117ca714d188cd1ab:
Eos Airlines, an all-business-class carrier, has declared bankruptcy and ceased operations.
The airline operated 220-seater Boeing 757s with 48 business-class seats.
Tickets cost up to $9,000 roundtrip, targeting high-end business travelers.
The airline has eliminated most employee positions, citing external forces beyond control.
46210bd0b15cd5bba64751d873674766decb2677:
Former terrorist suspects detained by the US were tortured, according to a report by Physicians for Human Rights.
Medical examinations of 11 former detainees showed physical and psychological evidence of torture and abuse.
The report includes cases of beatings, electric shock, sleep deprivation, and sexual humiliation.
The US government is urged to apologize and hold individuals accountable for the abuse.
4640d2f968f31bcf384d8253e055611b10f4a38b:
EPA imposes new restrictions on rat poisons to reduce accidental exposure to children and wildlife.
Only farmers, livestock owners, and certified rodent control employees can buy rat poison in bulk.
New rules require rat poisons to be kept in bait stations and containers that meet EPA standards.
Loose bait and four hazardous pesticides will no longer be sold for personal use.
467e1b592518a5660d0a3b7eda24ef9574fe0d11:
Banksy is Britain's most wanted artist, known for his subversive and satirical public art.
He has sold his work for hundreds of thousands of dollars, despite keeping his identity secret.
Banksy's art often depicts political messages, such as riot police with smiley acid-house faces.
His latest piece in East London may have revealed his identity, with a passer-by taking a photo of him at work.
46ce664a42eac4474d25c435a28790ec25137603:
Zimbabwe's President Robert Mugabe warns war veterans will take up arms to prevent opposition from taking power.
Mugabe claims opposition leader Morgan Tsvangirai would turn country back to white control.
Tsvangirai arrested twice, campaign buses impounded, as election tensions escalate.
Human Rights Watch declares presidential election "dead on arrival" due to violence and intimidation.
470618f9fd48a5d134a44b5de166b625f596a0b3:
A woman found her husband dead from an accidental overdose of drugs bought online without a prescription.
The drugs arrived every week, and she thought they were prescribed by a doctor.
The woman believes online pharmacies are "pushers" and only care about profits.
The DEA has seized over $39 million in cash and assets from online drug investigations.
470708aab0fe600a27423bf4a2f8c9860fe5f64b:
Turkish troops fired artillery shells into northern Iraq, nearly a week after completing an eight-day ground offensive.
At least 16 rounds were fired on Dashti Barzji, an uninhabited area in Irbil province, 12 miles from the border.
The Turkish military has been conducting cross-border airstrikes and artillery fire against the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK) militants.
The conflict has implications for the Middle East and Asia, with the US concerned about regional destabilization.
4739f160c87994f52e894591194f5df06fed4c39:
Charges against Bryant Purvis reduced to second-degree aggravated battery.
Purvis enters not guilty plea and focuses on studies and basketball.
Charges reduced for at least five of the "Jena 6" students.
Mychal Bell, 17, remains in jail for probation violation.
47f028dbf53e028eb6636c85d8b3ee0de6a1de7b:
The Justice Department plans to combat illegal export of US military technology to Iran and China.
Iran is the only country still flying the F-14 Tomcat, a highly sought-after military aircraft.
US to tighten monitoring of export licenses and increase restrictions on dual-use technologies.
Recent cases include illegal exports of stealth missile technology and F-14 components.
47fe0e2bba8206014fb53a7d5247efd1e316e087:
Gasoline prices set a record for the 16th consecutive day, averaging $3.62 per gallon.
Shell Oil Co. President John Hofmeister suggests increasing US oil production to reduce prices.
Hofmeister proposes a goal of producing 2-3 million barrels more oil per day.
He also defends Shell's profits, saying a 50% tax on windfall profits would slow investment.
4812698545d6a4c2243db340fad08d0b3b7fbe0b:
Conditions ease, allowing firefighters to gain ground against Southern California wildfires.
Winds drop to 30mph, humidity increases, and aircraft can finally fly.
Fire damage increases to 434,543 acres, with 1,664 structures destroyed.
Residents allowed to return to several neighborhoods, including Del Mar Highlands and Encinitas.
487b272b94a620f9660e89bbf6ebab3ffdf1bf06:
Venezuela raises taxes on alcohol and cigarettes to reduce consumption and prevent social and economic problems.
Prices increase by 10% for alcohol and 20% for cigarettes, affecting businesses and consumers.
President Hugo Chavez aims to cut back on drinking and smoking to promote a "new man" lifestyle.
Higher taxes on luxury items, such as Hummers, are also planned to reduce materialism.
48e4930e3c380330b609f460f11520be0e29d5fd:
Graeme Le Saux played over 400 matches, winning a Premier League title and 36 international caps.
He faced homophobic abuse due to false rumors about his sexuality, causing him to feel isolated.
A notable incident involved Robbie Fowler, who humiliated him in front of 40,000 people.
Le Saux believes football still has a long way to go in addressing homophobia and racism.
48e858dcb8dd62aad328f2c5f7fa052893d7304b:
European leaders agree to send 1,800-strong security force to Kosovo to maintain stability.
Force will be deployed ahead of Kosovo's expected declaration of independence from Serbia.
EU leaders balance support for Kosovo's independence with incentives for Serbia's EU membership.
Serbia's membership dependent on recognizing Kosovo's independence and handing over war criminals.
48fd5553806beaaa508596b0c8267a1ee703a8fe:
Rev. James Orange, a civil rights activist, died at 65 in Atlanta's Crawford Long Hospital.
He was jailed in 1965 for voting rights activism, sparking a fatal protest and the Selma-to-Montgomery march.
Jimmie Lee Jackson, a young black man, was shot during the protest and later died, leading to the Bloody Sunday march.
Orange's death led to the Voting Rights Act, signed into law by President Lyndon Johnson in 1965.
4929479f70e89deb22539e7d2caa6c33bbb0a14f:
Red Cross President Mark W. Everson resigns due to personal relationship with subordinate employee.
Everson cites "personal and family reasons" for departure, effective immediately.
Red Cross Board of Governors asks for and receives Everson's resignation.
Mary S. Elcano named interim president and CEO.
493fa8c40d1bc26ed1d25633c779b13bc33efdba:
Children as young as 15 are becoming involved in terrorist-related activity in Britain.
At least 2,000 people in Britain pose a threat to security due to al Qaeda support.
Terrorist plots in the UK are increasingly inspired by al Qaeda in Iraq and East Africa.
Russian covert intelligence officers continue to operate in Britain, diverting counter-terrorism resources.
4963edb0ad2703e9f6c54593149d9b81e7ada91f:
Kenya's disputed election result has led to hundreds of deaths and forced tens of thousands to flee.
Businesses have been destroyed, and supply routes disrupted, affecting the country's economy.
The Nairobi Stock Exchange lost 40 billion Kenyan Shillings in value, and the government is losing revenue.
Tourists have been advised to stay indoors and away from major cities, and the industry is expected to take a hit.
499fdb9bf024f6fbfd605792594372df22ec12f0:
Queen Elizabeth II launched Heathrow's $8.6 billion Terminal 5, part of a plan to maintain its status as a major transport hub.
The new terminal has been 15 years in the making and will handle 30 million passengers annually.
Business groups welcome the expansion, citing its importance for Britain's economic competitiveness.
Environmental groups, however, criticize the project for contributing to climate change.
49d1a193a2c477f5861b593f06681b35b0e49573:
Lyon beats Valenciennes 2-0, staying four points ahead in the French league.
Juninho and Sidney Govou score for Lyon, with Govou's goal coming three minutes from time.
Nancy celebrates its 40th anniversary with a 1-0 win over Bordeaux.
Stade Rennes falls to Monaco 1-0, while Paris St Germain wins 2-1 at Racing Strasbourg.
49d4ad731a44b7576e3e3271b1eee2f0219883c2:
Two tornadoes struck suburban Washington on Sunday, causing damage to homes and trees.
The first tornado hit St. Charles, Maryland, with winds of up to 80 mph.
A second tornado followed outside Hyattsville, Maryland, with winds reaching 100 mph.
No injuries were reported in the tornadoes.
4a1de02b50578df33ea7b0cb384bdd6aaf4ee119:
A 19-year-old Marine is deploying to Iraq, leaving his mother worried about his safety.
His mother, Samantha Schroeder, says he's determined to do his job with skill and pride.
Military families share their stories of sacrifice, from deployment to reintegration.
Some wives keep their true feelings hidden to support their husbands' morale.
4a30d8e9ba08a56c1d503d719525113545c414e3:
Laura Bush urges Myanmar's military junta to step aside and allow for democratic government.
She calls for the release of Aung San Suu Kyi and other opposition leaders.
Bush says the regime's position grows weaker by the day and the time for a free Burma is now.
The US first lady is calling for a transition to democracy in Myanmar.
4a32d5f29cfb35f3a3966ee041fc1f358503f4b4:
Benfica's Augustin Binya banned for six European matches after horror tackle on Celtic's Scott Brown.
Brown avoided injury but claimed Binya tried to break his leg with the tackle.
UEFA's control and disciplinary body described the challenge as "serious" and "endangering physical health".
Benfica can appeal the ban, which would rule Binya out of remaining Group D matches.
4a403faad8116c40f4cb960d3ffad081106341ad:
Lawyer Terrye Cheathem creates greeting cards for prison inmates, addressing mixed emotions and tough love.
Cards express good wishes, celebrate holidays, and offer tough love, saying "Look, things need to be different when you get out."
More than 2.3 million people are in US jails or prisons, a higher proportion than any other country.
Cards also designed for inmates to send to relatives, with messages like "Thank you for visiting" and "Thank you for bringing the kids."
4a70f83728ee66801be719df00060cda4c25817f:
Federal government releases 113 photos of a Halloween party at Immigration and Customs Enforcement.
ICE chief Julie Myers posed with an employee wearing prison stripes and skin-darkening makeup.
Myers ordered photos deleted, citing error in judgment and concern for agency's dignity and respect.
Photos' release sparks outrage among lawmakers, who say they should have been made public earlier.
4aa90d4a364e8bd252a2a2e57f1bb4c9dab57062:
A ship crash and oil spill in San Francisco Bay killed nearly 400 birds and prompted a federal criminal probe.
The US Coast Guard said "human error factors" likely contributed to the crash, which occurred on Wednesday.
About 58,000 gallons of heavy-duty bunker oil spilled into the bay, sickening birds and forming globules on beaches.
The Coast Guard is investigating the accident, with the National Transportation Safety Board also conducting an inquiry.
4ad70f84c363e5b594da00983e2b40600f12ca54:
One suspect, Demario James Atwater, 21, charged with first-degree murder in Eve Carson's death.
Second suspect, Lawrence Alvin Lovett Jr., 17, being sought in connection with the killing.
Atwater arrested at a Durham residence after a tip from authorities.
Carson, 22, was found shot to death on March 5 near UNC-Chapel Hill.
4b0eda92463958cce8c6b2537db39088e1254552:
Officials search for driver of white truck seen near Santiago fire's origin.
Vehicle is a 1998-2004 Ford F150 with chrome tubular running boards.
$250,000 reward offered for information leading to arrest of fire starter.
Santiago fire is 27,000 acres and still burning, with 14 homes destroyed.
4b23ce1db7253bf118b493c9bea7d6899012cc88:
Nicaragua breaks diplomatic relations with Colombia in solidarity with Ecuador.
Colombia attacked a rebel camp in Ecuador, killing 17 and sparking regional tensions.
OAS passes resolution to ease tensions, calls attack a violation of sovereignty and international law.
US Defense Secretary Gates sees little chance of war erupting between Colombia, Ecuador, and Venezuela.
4b25022fda48e7f91ab1459f1a6dca501318672e:
Two men who claimed to have found Bigfoot's carcass admit it was a hoax, a joke that got out of hand.
They used a Sasquatch costume, possum roadkill, and slaughterhouse leftovers to create the fake body.
Matt Whitton, a police officer, was fired from his job due to his role in the hoax.
The hoaxers have hired an attorney to represent them against potential civil and criminal prosecution.
4b40ad1f0e59b139e9a1466859ee08a048ca8d2c:
John McWethy, 61, died in a Colorado skiing accident after losing control and hitting a tree.
He was a former ABC News chief national security correspondent and had recently moved to Boulder.
McWethy was wearing a helmet at the time of the accident and died while being treated for blunt-force injuries.
Friends and colleagues remembered him as an outstanding reporter and a humble person.
4b6f2532f6bb4cf4ae341e4fb72d384ef58f0f42:
Tariq Aziz's trial for executing 42 Iraqi merchants in 1992 has begun, delayed due to co-defendant's illness.
Ali Hassan al-Majeed, aka "Chemical Ali," is awaiting execution for genocide in the 1980s.
Trial resumes May 20, with Aziz appearing frail and represented by a private attorney.
Fierce fighting in Baghdad sees US troops kill 32 "enemy forces" in a gunbattle.
4b89e8a6a25de61d21a1fed20fb911cd4b1e4b47:

Ross Lovegrove is a fiercely original industrial designer known for his tactile and sensual designs.

62 members of the Gambino, Genovese, and Bonanno families face 80 charges, including money laundering and murder.

c4e4f565d15f76b1e367d4fc2e7a2648c3cd395c:
Nurse practitioner Arlene Samen founded One H.E.A.R.T. to combat high infant and maternal mortality rates in Tibet and globally.

Diana's former butler, Paul Burrell, claims to know a "secret" about the late princess, but it's already in the public domain.

Myanmar's neighbors China and India criticized for not doing enough to aid cyclone victims.

f489b07406c653968a0ed21c00e28c9124e4a49b:
Ajax drew 2-2 with Vitesse Arnhem, losing ground to PSV Eindhoven in the Dutch league.
Urby Emanuelson and Luis Suarez scored for Ajax, but Harrie Gommans equalized.
PSV beat Excelsior 2-1, while Feyenoord drew 1-1 with Groningen.
Heracles won 5-0 at Venlo, while Sparta Rotterdam and NEC Nijmegen secured vital victories.
f4f90d4ff5af3e3648055673e040f0f43ae076d2:
Rep. Tom Lantos, Democratic chairman of House Committee on Foreign Affairs, died at 80 due to complications from cancer.

Lantos represented his Northern California district for 14 terms and was a Holocaust survivor.

He was an outspoken human rights advocate and critic of the Iraq War.

Lantos was remembered as a man of integrity and moral conviction by colleagues.
f51cff1d73cd0f3954376d7b3eab1d5b2ccb354c:
US government fines mine operator $1.34 million for coal mine collapse that killed six miners in Utah.
Insufficient pillar support and mining in unstable areas caused the August collapse.
Government also fined a mining consultant $220,000 for faulty analysis of the mine's design.
Mine owner admitted to using risky mining technique, retreat mining, at the mine.
f54f84affaebd1d86011ad31adbf9fac4754a8f2:
A tornado hit Atlanta's historic Cabbagetown district, causing destruction and flooding.
Residents describe the storm's sudden arrival with no warning, causing chaos.
Many homes were damaged or destroyed, with some people forced to flee.
The neighborhood's renaissance began when artists and urban pioneers moved in.
f5692f8e01389a631dadcb70cfd4be3ff0ae45d3:
Nine people killed, 19 injured in tour bus crash in southeastern Utah.
Bus carrying 50 people on ski trip from Telluride, Colorado to Phoenix, Arizona.
Vehicle lost control on curve, rolled over several times, ejecting occupants.
Four men, five women killed in crash, most returning from ski trip.
f5f7571a69e96c1d288d939861b7216c2bdc0ae4:
Pope Benedict XVI arrives in the US for a six-day visit, starting with a White House welcome.
He is greeted by President Bush, first lady Laura Bush, and their daughter Jenna.
The pope's visit aims to energize the US Catholic community, estimated at 70 million members.
Security preparations are under way, with 27 agencies protecting the pope during his visit.
f63877ffefceaf9a2a13a9277f4d861f9b9b8a73:
Lonely Planet author admits to plagiarizing and making up travel guidebook content.
He also claims to have dealt drugs and accepted free travel, violating company policy.
Kohnstamm's book on Colombia was written in San Francisco, not Colombia, and used information from an intern.
Company reviewing his books, promising to take urgent steps to correct any inaccuracies.
f675d806e17d1920e6622d3a925367697c94e58e:
Former Olympic champion Angel Matos faces life ban for kicking referee in the face.
Matos was disqualified for taking too much injury time in his taekwondo match.
He reacted by pushing a judge and kicking the referee, leaving him with a bloody lip.
Matos and his coach are in hot water for their angry reactions.
f6d43a207c2b3c48e787087b345c23d2fb1dc92f:
A second "person of interest" is sought in the murder of UNC student body president Eve Carson.
A shadowy figure appears in the back seat of an SUV in ATM surveillance photos.
Police have not identified the driver, who was wearing a hooded sweatshirt and Astros cap.
A memorial service will be held for Carson after students return from spring break.
f70a7abb6c5b0ef383ea12a4d9ca046a5bd854e5:
A Colorado man spent $10,000 on security after testifying against his daughter's abusive boyfriend.
The state did nothing to protect him, despite threats and a hit being put on his family.
Witness intimidation has become "almost epidemic," according to the National District Attorneys Association.
Colorado's witness protection program has a budget of $50,000, but spends only $1,000 per witness.
f732a658c314c090257225483075e4d9fde28b95:
Italy coach Roberto Donadoni selects Cristiano Lucarelli for Euro 2008 qualifier against Scotland.
Lucarelli scores twice against South Africa, earning a spot in the Italian squad.
Veteran forwards Filippo Inzaghi and Alessandro Del Piero are left out of the squad.
Captain Fabio Cannavaro returns from suspension, boosting Italy's chances in the match.
f79341438eed40986c3219b67a3b5d87eb6c018a:
Zimbabwe's opposition party reports 4 activists and the mayor's wife killed by Mugabe supporters ahead of presidential runoff.
US Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice accuses Mugabe of sponsoring violence against opposition supporters.
Tendai Biti, opposition secretary-general, charged with treason and faces death penalty if convicted.
Mugabe warns war veterans will take up arms again if Tsvangirai wins the election.
f7e5e75031e9f099564ed046bd822ef1bedb3188:
President Bush tells Air Force Academy graduates that defeating terrorism requires American resolve.
He compares current wars to World War II, emphasizing the need for rebuilding and alliance-building.
Bush acknowledges the challenges of modern warfare, including rebuilding under fire from terrorist networks.
Success in war is redefined as stability, democracy, and economic viability in Iraq and Afghanistan.
f856ca4cd15992e0e88ae9113bf31b2a5ab55072:
Stuart MacGill announces retirement from international cricket after 10 years and 207 wickets.
He will retire after the ongoing second Test against West Indies.
MacGill made his Test debut 10 years ago and took 207 wickets at an average of 28.28.
He will be remembered for his contributions to Australian cricket.
f85e12129885fad0eabd6a1c6b6b24dbf8948db5:
Seven college students died in a weekend fire at a North Carolina beach house.
The owner's 18-year-old daughter survived but was hospitalized with smoke inhalation.
Authorities are investigating the cause of the fire, but foul play is not suspected.
Six University of South Carolina students and one Clemson University student died in the fire.
f874dc1da36d2c45a65f78dc0dc9dcdf5846c3c9:
Hello Kitty, a Japanese brand, has become a global phenomenon with over 50,000 products featuring her image.
The brand's success is attributed to its focus on social communication and thoughtful gifting.
Sanrio's CEO, Shintaro Tsuji, emphasizes the importance of friendship, cuteness, and thoughtfulness in the brand's success.
Hello Kitty has become a cultural icon, responsible for over half of Sanrio's billion-dollar annual turnover.
f8be2f5ce06cb4af91cbb7b6bef9835991751ef5:
A 7-year-old girl was raped while in the care of a baby sitter, her mother hired.
The suspect, Chester Arthur Stiles, 37, is being sought and is a former animal trainer.
The girl's mother was unaware of the abuse until a family friend recognized her daughter on TV.
The FBI is also seeking Stiles in a separate matter involving state charges of sexual assault.
f8ddc6d36f378757d27a244529f8fe11672baa41:
A judge declared a mistrial in the retrial of six men accused of plotting with al Qaeda.
Narseal Batiste, the alleged ringleader, testified he wasn't serious about the threats.
The decision marks the second time prosecutors failed to convince a jury of guilt.
The government's next move is unclear, with a possible third trial looming.
f9689fb9656132e1c6d186851563f2b968643791:
Robert A. Singer, 49, arrested for distributing child pornography over the Internet.
Singer, COO of National Children's Museum, sent images to undercover detective posing as 12-year-old girl and her mother.
Charged with five counts of distributing child pornography, faces up to 140 years in prison.
Museum officials say they are "horrified" by the news and have suspended Singer from his post.
f974fe1b3777ffc5756322c0bb3f31a9b23ec09a:
The US believes Pakistan's spy service supported the deadly bombing of India's Embassy in Afghanistan.
Pakistan denies the allegation, calling it "unfounded and malicious".
The US has "strong suspicion" the Taliban was behind the attack, with possible aid from Pakistan's ISI.
Evidence was presented to senior Pakistani officials by a top CIA official.
f9b3e0253b7325cd0d37841a38c9f10a22c77c49:
Lebanese voters replace two ruling-party lawmakers killed in recent months.
Pro-government candidate Mohammed al-Amin Itani wins in Beirut.
Anti-government candidate Camille Khouri upsets former President Amin Gemayel in Metn.
Results closely watched ahead of potential presidential run by Michel Aoun.
f9fedde4734d8ac3431c0ed5d338efcd799b1aea:
Tropical Storm Fay stalled near Cape Canaveral, Florida, bringing heavy rain and flooding to east-central Florida.
The storm could dump 30 inches of rain in some areas, with streets flooded in Port St. Lucie.
Fay has made landfall three times, with the National Hurricane Center predicting a fourth landfall in northern Florida.
The storm has caused historic flooding in Brevard County, with tornadoes reported in seven counties.
fa5089d759a9fb810d28c140cf60e3a5fffff8ba:
Start the day with yum cha in Sydney's China Town, then shop at Queen Victoria Building and David Jones.
Walk off breakfast in the city, exploring boutiques and architecture in Paddington and Woollahra.
Enjoy lunch with a view at Icebergs restaurant, overlooking Bondi Beach, then do the coastal walk.
End the day with sun downers at the Opera Bar, and consider a dinner at one of Sydney's top restaurants.
fa67b52d4597e227947776fd40a4b16f402ed12d:
Aung San Suu Kyi is "ready to cooperate" with Myanmar's government and seeks dialogue with the ruling junta.
She met with three executive members of her National League for Democracy for the first time in three years.
Suu Kyi welcomed the appointment of Aung Kyi as a liaison between government and herself.
The UN's special envoy to Myanmar said the situation is not what it was "a few weeks ago".
faac3a6337907b1552b7068c8701cae665c4885c:
A German woman held hostage in Iraq since February has been freed.
Her son, Sinan, remains in captivity, and Germany is working to secure his release.
Militants had demanded Germany withdraw its troops from Afghanistan to free the pair.
The woman was taken to Germany's embassy in Baghdad after her release.
fab941df6ecc8251b49d28715504baf4ac31dcf9:
Armenian President Robert Kocharian declares state of emergency after clashes between police and protesters.
Protesters claim last month's presidential election was rigged, demanding results be voided.
Clashes began when authorities cleared Freedom Square of thousands of demonstrators.
State of emergency may last until March 20, but government hopes to lift it sooner.
faf3821150b0c63290cbbddd7a8b54900995ea5a:
Kimi Raikkonen criticizes Lewis Hamilton for pit-lane accident at Canadian Grand Prix.
Hamilton's mistake ruined Raikkonen's chance of winning the race.
Raikkonen says he's unhappy, not angry, about the incident.
Hamilton apologizes for ruining Raikkonen's race.
fb0003754a764d7f3252120de58b515d1f882556:
2nd Lt. Holley Wimunc, 24, missing after fire at her Fayetteville, North Carolina apartment.
Evidence of arson found at the scene, with a neighbor reporting a man running away.
Wimunc's husband, John, a Marine, is being questioned by police.
Wimunc is a nurse at Fort Bragg's Womack Army Hospital, assigned to Charlie Company.
fb17ac082bd3f3af3dad8c8d36d9ea56360c520e:
2-year-old Riley Ann Sawyers was beaten, thrown, and held underwater before being placed in a storage box.
Her mother, Kimberly Trenor, described the abuse and disposal of the body to police.
Trenor and her husband, Royce Zeigler, were arrested and charged with injuring a child and tampering with evidence.
DNA analysis is still in progress to confirm the identification of the child's body.
fb6516de631cade629b797e8f40f377523c4aa0e:
Michael Mukasey's nomination for attorney general was approved by the Senate with a 53-40 vote.
Mukasey considers waterboarding "repugnant" but cannot categorically say it's torture.
Two key Democrats, Feinstein and Schumer, voted in favor of Mukasey despite controversy.
Mukasey pledged to enforce a law banning waterboarding if Congress passes one.
fb8431bc320c2c1a6c32699da0fdae228ed8d73b:
House inspector-general to investigate allegations of sexual misconduct among congressional pages.
Two pages dismissed for allegedly having oral sex in public areas of their dormitory.
Rep. Ginny Brown-Waite resigns from House Page Board to protest lax oversight.
House Speaker Nancy Pelosi and Minority Leader John Boehner to review findings.
fba410776268aaf447802e66ac94e4af54f7cb7a:
925 people killed and 2,605 wounded in Baghdad's Sadr City fighting, says government official.
Iraqi civilians caught in crossfire as militants use population to cover themselves.
U.S. military reports 50 deaths in April, highest monthly toll since September.
Fighting in Sadr City continues despite cleric Muqtada al-Sadr's cease-fire call.
fbb06b75e3963c5a810c9f73e4dc5382fbcb7405:
Michael Vick tests positive for marijuana use, violating his pretrial release conditions.
He must submit to random drug testing and participate in substance abuse therapy.
Vick's restrictions include staying home between 10 p.m. and 6 a.m. and electronic monitoring.
He faces possible prison term of 12 to 18 months in federal conspiracy case.
fbc2d5f3f088eda2b8128ebb12a042850f6e4f3d:
Chris Benoit idolized the Dynamite Kid, a professional wrestler known for high-flying moves.
Benoit murdered his wife and son, then hanged himself in June.
The Dynamite Kid, Tom Billington, blames wrestling and steroids for his own injuries.
WWE Chairman Vince McMahon denies any connection between WWE and Benoit's actions.
fbc6a4d0697b2a3e8b549dcb1f80a8ce7bf47e34:
John Terry's fitness uncertain for Champions League match with Valencia due to broken cheekbone.
Terry trained with a face mask on at Valencia's Mestalla stadium on Tuesday.
Frank Lampard ruled out of the match due to ongoing thigh injury.
Michael Essien expected to play after recovering from leg injury.
fbcaa7519e9ff82193afbaed67d8706f2350125f:
The SPAM Museum in Austin, Minnesota, celebrates 70 years of SPAM with a "wall of SPAM" and a scale model of a SPAM plant.
The National Museum of Funeral History in Houston features exhibits on embalming, caskets, and "fantasy coffins" designed by Ghanaian artist Kane Quaye.
The Hobo Museum in Britt, Iowa, details the history and culture of tramps, with tours available by appointment and a nearby Hobo Cemetery.
The Mütter Museum in Philadelphia showcases unusual medical phenomena, including the world's
fc8f0e54e2627ebe705735f0565d77ca64579d92:
A Chinese couple tried to name their baby "@" due to its connection to love and e-mail addresses.
The unusual name stands out in Chinese, which uses multi-stroke characters instead of an alphabet.
The father explained that the "@" symbol means "love him" when translated into Chinese.
The name is an example of China's increasingly adventurous approach to language, officials say.
fd13c81373473f862d0f3559ffbc2a03fa95f492:
The US Olympic Committee and IOC seek to shut down scam ticket websites.
www.beijingticketing.com and www.beijing-2008tickets.com accused of duping customers.
Scam has affected Olympic fans worldwide, with losses up to $57,000 reported.
Sites allegedly used Olympic trademarks to obtain personal and financial info.
fd5ae29a3ed2e9093c12dcbb12fcb5c67217b0f5:
Gray wolf removed from endangered list after 30 years, sparking controversy.
1,500 gray wolves thrive in Yellowstone National Park, but can be hunted outside.
Conservationists fear hundreds of wolves could be killed by hunters and ranchers.
Ranchers, however, see wolves as a threat to their livestock.
fd93b423a3805de1c259d527393fd5fb75d06a55:
Barack Obama's gospel concerts in South Carolina feature Donnie McClurkin, who is anti-gay.
McClurkin's views sparked controversy among the gay community, who feel Obama is "sucking up to anti-gay bigots".
Obama's campaign has targeted African-American churchgoers in South Carolina to win over black voters.
The controversy highlights Obama's efforts to unite disparate voting blocs, including religious voters.
fdb2b65b9cb99b7d52559ae647cae293cb5910d3:
At least 19 schoolgirls died in a fire at Buddo Junior School in Mpigi, Uganda.
Two adults' bodies were found in the ashes, with 42 girls surviving.
Police investigate the cause, with conflicting reports of doors being locked or not.
The fire occurred in the dormitory late Monday, with an explosion reported beforehand.
fdb54e157f8f4e5a479dbc6288587e52fffde33f:
Omar bin Laden, son of Osama, says he left al Qaeda in 2000 to find a peaceful way to help Muslims.
He wants his father to stop using violence and find another way to achieve his goals.
Omar bin Laden is launching a movement for peace with his wife, a multi-month horserace through North Africa.
He believes his father's actions are not justified and has no idea where his father is currently living.
fe9d63d0ed719a42735cadaf10e76416545f680c:
Lewis Hamilton signs 5-year contract with McLaren worth $140m.
He's expected to become one of the most marketable sports stars, earning over $1 billion.
Hamilton's articulate, young, and charismatic, making him a breath of fresh air in Formula One.
He's poised to surpass Michael Schumacher's earnings, becoming the sport's highest-paid driver.
ff10934c1dc127286575fb1a6b192da6da21f235:
About 50 students broke into a Dutch consulate in Indonesia to protest an anti-Islamic film.
The 15-minute film "Fitna" features disturbing images and Quran verses to paint Islam as a threat.
Dutch Prime Minister Jan Beter Balkanende worries the film could provoke a violent backlash.
The film has prompted protests in other parts of the Muslim world, including Pakistan.
ffb817ce85d7c19720ebbf0b43b01d0da61e9c06:
Joran van der Sloot questioned in Netherlands about Natalee Holloway's disappearance.
He denied any role in her vanishing, citing marijuana influence.
Video footage shows van der Sloot saying he was with Holloway when she died.
Authorities execute search warrants at van der Sloot's residences, seizing hard drive and laptop.
ffb8b9be838da033f6f3383f324d425556723147:
Simon Mann, a British mercenary, jailed for 34 years for plotting a coup in Equatorial Guinea.
He confessed to trying to topple President Teodoro Obiang Nguema Mbasogo in 2004.
Mann denied being the plot's leader, saying Lebanese businessman Eli Calil was in charge.
Mann's trial revealed connections to Mark Thatcher, son of former British Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher.
fff32094b00f3780cc98fe43bd98aace4b851281:
Novak Djokovic crashes out of Paris Masters with a 6-3 6-2 loss to Fabrice Santoro.
Djokovic struggles with dental surgery recovery, unable to give his best performance.
Andy Murray advances to the third round with a 7-6 6-3 win over Jarkko Nieminen.
Rafael Nadal reaches the third round with a 6-3 6-1 victory over Filippo Volandri.
